movies.title: Hue and Cry
movies.plot: A gang of street boys foil a master crook who sends commands for robberies by cunningly altering a comic strip's wording each week, unknown to writer and printer. The first of the Ealing comedies.
movies.simplePlot: A gang of street boys foil a master crook who sends commands for robberies by cunningly altering a comic strip's wording each week, unknown to writer and printer. The first of the Ealing ...

biography.bio: Harry Fowler was born on December 10, 1926 in Lambeth, London, England as Henry James Fowler. He is known for his work on The Army Game (1957), Hue and Cry (1947) and Went the Day Well? (1942). He was married to Catherine Palmer and Joan Dowling. He died on January 4, 2012 in London.
biography.name: Harry Fowler

biography.bio: Frederick Piper was born on September 23, 1902 in London, England. He was an actor, known for Jamaica Inn (1939), Hue and Cry (1947) and 49th Parallel (1941). He died on September 22, 1979 in Berkshire, England.
biography.name: Frederick Piper

biography.bio: Vida Hope was born on December 16, 1910 in Liverpool, Merseyside, England as Vida B. F. Hope. She is known for her work on The Man in the White Suit (1951), Hue and Cry (1947) and The Life and Adventures of Nicholas Nickleby (1947). She was married to Derek N. Twist. She died on December 23, 1963 in Chelmsford, Essex, England.
biography.name: Vida Hope

biography.bio: Heather Delaine is an actress, known for Hue and Cry (1947).
biography.name: Heather Delaine

biography.bio: Douglas Barr was born in 1932. He is an actor, known for Fortune Lane (1947), Hue and Cry (1947) and The Last Load (1948).
biography.name: Douglas Barr

biography.bio: Stanley Escane was born on May 2, 1927 in London, England. He was an actor, known for Hue and Cry (1947), I Believe in You (1952) and The Slasher (1953). He died in October 1996 in Barnet, Hertfordshire, England.
biography.name: Stanley Escane

biography.bio: Ian Dawson is an actor, known for Hue and Cry (1947), Rehearsal for a Drama (1939) and Dance Without Music (1939).
biography.name: Ian Dawson

biography.bio: Gerald Fox was born in 1930 in London, England. He was an actor, known for Hue and Cry (1947), Brothers in Law (1957) and Fame Is the Spur (1947). He died in 1993 in Camden, London.
biography.name: Gerald Fox

biography.bio: David Simpson is an actor, known for Hue and Cry (1947).
biography.name: David Simpson

biography.bio: Albert Hughes is an actor, known for Hue and Cry (1947).
biography.name: Albert Hughes

biography.bio: John Hudson was born on January 24, 1919 in Gilroy, California, USA as John C. Hudson. He was an actor, known for The Screaming Skull (1958), Gunfight at the O.K. Corral (1957) and G.I. Blues (1960). He was married to Mary LaRoche. He died on April 8, 1996 in Los Angeles, California.
biography.name: John Hudson

biography.bio: David Knox is an actor, known for Hue and Cry (1947) and It Always Rains on Sunday (1947).
biography.name: David Knox

biography.bio: Jeffrey Sirett was born in 1931 in Willesden, London, England. He was an actor, known for Hue and Cry (1947). He died in 1983 in the USA.
biography.name: Jeffrey Sirett

biography.bio: James Crabbe is an actor, known for Hue and Cry (1947), William Comes to Town (1948) and The Whole World Over (1950).
biography.name: James Crabbe

biography.bio: Joan Dowling had a passion for acting and as an aspiring young actress she would take roles in plays, pantomimes and other works simply to be on the stage. Her first recognised role was at the tender age of 14 and she signed her first film contract at 17. She had natural talent and did not have any coaching, voice or other lessons before being 'discovered'. She was well known for her roles in Ealing Studios productions and met her husband, Harry Fowler, on the set of the 1947 Ealing comedy Hue and Cry (1947). Sadly, Joan's life did not have a happy ending and she committed suicide in 1954 - a mere 26 years old.
biography.name: Joan Dowling
